CatDescriptText: Mr. Scott Campbell, single, college student, Brownsville, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, September 26, 1959, pg. A1, with question: "Do you believe in divorce even though most religious groups frown upon it, and some actually ban it except under very extenuating circumstances?" answer reads: "If two people don't get along, the marriage is a complete failure and they are hitting each other over the head, it is best for them to divorce or to separeate until they view things differently."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Scott Campbell wearing flecked suit jacket and eyeglasses, standing in front of Jenkins Arcade with Thrift Drugs store in background, Liberty Avenue, Downtown
